priorityQueue
Class HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  priorityQueue.HeapPriorityQueue<K,V>
      priorityQueue.HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the key.
V - the value.
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdaptablePriorityQueue<K,V>, PriorityQueue<K,V>
public class HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue<K,V>
extends HeapPriorityQueue<K,V>
implements AdaptablePriorityQueue<K,V>

The HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue represents an unbounded HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue. This class extends HeapPriorityQueue providing additional methods that would be useful in some situations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
SuperJulietta

HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue

public HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue(V[] v,
                                  K[] k,
                                  java.util.Comparator<K> comp)
Creates an HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue that orders its elements according to the specified comparator in linear time.

Parameters:
v - the list of key to insert.
k - the list of value to insert(relative to value v).
comp - the comparator to use for this HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue.
Method Detail

insert

public Entry<K,V> insert(K k,
                         V v)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
Inserts an entry in this HeapPriorityQueue. If a violation of the heap-order property succeed the up-heap method is invoked to restore this property.

Specified by:

v - the value.

the entry created.
